CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 10, 1959, pg. 11, reads: "Opera Women's Committee - Mary Cardwell Dawson, founder of the national Negro Opera Company and Foundation, standing, organized a Pittsburgh Women's Committee, Sept. 30, at the YMCA. Seated, clockwise: Ethel Ramos Harris, chairman of the Pittsburgh Women's Committee; Mrs. O'Latrice C. Beckum [O'Labrice Beckom], corresponding secretary; Miss E. Marie Coleman, recording secretary; Mrs. Catherine Arnetta C. Gardner, membership chairman; Mrs. Peggy Pierce Freeman, chairman, Pittsburgh Opera Guild, NNOC; Miss Doris Vinini, representing Mr.s Alma Illery, honorary chairman, and Eugene Cardwell, parliamentarian and business manager. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Mary Cardwell Dawson standing at table with clockwise: Ethel Ramos Harris, O'Labrice Beckom, E. Marie Coleman, Catherine Arnetta C. Gardner, Peggy Pierce Freeman, Doris Vinini, and Eugene Cardwell, for Opera Women's Committee meeting, YMCA, another version
